page.title: 01Wentworth and Longcross
page.content: The area is essentially Bagshot sand with some peat and gravel. There are large areas of scrub land growing heather, gorse and deciduous trees e.g. silver birch. The two original estates have been converted into the exclusive Wentworth Estate, large residential houses set in 1/4 acre to several acre plots The internationally known Wentworh Golf Course divides the plots. The two original houses remain, one as the golf club house, the other as flats. A development of smaller properties lies to the east of the block. The north west square is cut by the A30 and the south of the block by the M3. There is virtually no industry in the area, apart from a military establishment. The bulk of the population commutes either to London or surrounding industrial business areas. The rail service is
